properties.areaDesc: Lawrence, IL; Crawford, IL; Knox, IN; Sullivan, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 9:08PM EST until January 24 at 8:12PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Wabash River...White River...


.As of mid-Tuesday evening, minor to moderate flooding either
continues or is forecast on the Wabash, White, and East Fork White
Rivers in central and southern Indiana.  Flooding has ended on most
or all creeks and smaller rivers.  Flooding is the result of up to
about 4 inches of rain that fell late last week.

Crests will be/are comparable to those that occurred in February
and June of 2019.

The Wabash River is either cresting or slightly past crest from
Covington to Terre Haute.  The crest will reach Hutsonville
mid-day Thursday.  The White River crest is between Elliston and
Newberry.  The crest along the East Fork White River is nearing
nearing Rivervale where it should top out at about 28.9 feet
mid-day Wednesday.  Flooding along the lower portions of the White
and Wabash River is likely to continue until the weekend of
January 25.

Little or no precipitation is in the forecast through Thursday,
which will allow drainage to continue out of area rivers this week.
Above normal precipitation is possible this coming Friday through
Saturday, which could exacerbate elevated water levels and lead to
renewed flooding on area waterways.  Precipitation is expected to
start off as snow then transition to rain late Friday into Friday
night.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Riverton.
* until Friday January 24.
* At  8:00 PM Tuesday the stage was 18.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 20.4 feet by late Thursday night
then begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Friday January
24.
* At 20.7 feet...Leaverton Park at Palestine, Illinois extensively
floods including the campground area.  Rodeo area still dry at this
level. Most if not all local unimproved roads leading to the Wabash
River in the Palestine area are impassable by any land vehicle.
Extensive backwater flooding of Minnow Slough, Sugar Creek and
Lamotte Creek in Palestine area. Numerous river cabins surrounded
by water across the river from Merom Bluff. Backyards of a few
residences southeast of Palestine along East River Road flood.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
